title: Ha you Malzahar mains want his rework reverted. Funny guys.
body:
Take it from a {{champion:72}} player, Riot would rather put your champ through 5 more reworks with thousands of work hours than just admit they messed up.

Find a similar champion and hop over, it's just easier that way.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=TheThundersRoar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=YGptERpv,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-05-07T00:06:21.518+0000)
>
> Riot would rather put your champ through 5 more reworks with thousands of work hours than just admit they messed up.

well, Riot admits they messed up quite often. however, they've only reverted a single rework that i know of ({{champion:96}}) unless of course the boards definition of "admitting a fuck up" is just reverting the change, regardless of what they actually say. now, this is not to say they admitted they messed up with the {{champion:90}} rework, because i can't remember them saying anything like that, but i just wanted to say that Riot *does* admit fuck ups every now and then. i believe they admitted it with {{champion:82}} and {{champion:72}} with the juggernaut update as an example. however, instead of reverting the changes, they decided to leave them as is until a VGU, which i guess is the real "fuck up" that everyone refers to in regard to these champs. which i can agree with.

The Mordekaiser rework might as well be a reversion. Almost every nerf/change they made to him pushed him further back toward his original playstyle. Sure, Q is still different and W is as well but you have to admit each change was them taking Morde further and further away from bot lane.
Thanks to Malicious Metal...because if it weren't for him he'd never be viable mid or top.

Let's....not pretend the boards have that much sway. While MM rants a lot about Mordekaiser, I don't think he was the driving force behind the changes. 

We're a fraction of a fraction of the entire league community. Besides, if Riot listened to the boards, we'd see some rather batshit changes coming to the game.
MM was pretty much the driving force to making Morde what he is now. Rioters were literally co-oping with his feedback until Morde ended up in a decent spot.
Were they really? I've actually never heard about this.

Yup. It's the main reason he's so popular around here...or maybe his steadily growing popularity made him a good candidate to work with to get those changes made. Whatever it was, it's unique to the Morde situation. Never seen anything like it for any other champ.

Have you got any proof of this?
I don't disagree but it sounds a lot like you're spreading rumors and witch-hunting.

Witch hunting Malicious? Everyone LOVES Malicious. Ask him yourself if you find him on the boards or make a thread asking for it yourself if you don't believe me. You don't have to believe me, just like you're free to put the answer "5" to the question "How many sides does a square have?"
So what you're getting out is that you don't have any proof?

There's a bit but riot never really admits completely to using user submissions, though Malicious Metal is stated as the first mordekaiser main their going to call on to help them with the rework. With any rework they call on both low ELO and high ELO mains to assess and test changes to make sure the champion feels good to them(which is why i hate people complaining about resent reworks, they only started doing this last season i believe). Riot stated in a comment on one of his threads a few months ago that they appreciate his commitment to the champion(Blah Blah) and that his rants are seen and taken into consideration. That is most likely Meddler but honestly i can't remember( i will look it up to see if i can find it though).

I mean, if you go into concepts and creations every so often, you'll start to notice that they do take what we say into consideration sometimes. If they acknowledge us though then they have to give compensation for our idea so that's probably why we don't get it that much.  Meddler and several other champion designer's said that when they start to stump on a champion they go into that thread and search up key words related to what they want to make, like with Vi they searched up "Fighter" and found a lot of helpful threads that sparked their creativity. That's actually the reason i always post a concept if i make one, a rioter might use it and it'll help create a champion. Camille might have been strongly influenced by one of the top posts in Concepts which is "Rae" look it up. 

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/g4sIExo4-thoughts-on-warwicks-rework

It's not the exact comment i was thinking of but it does show that they take his opinion seriously and respect him as a mordekaiser main.

Riot has fully admitted to user submissions before. They literally paraded the fact that Scarra was involved in Katarina's rework, and plenty of skins in the past were made via collaboration with fans, who were mentioned in name.  

Of course they respect his opinion as a Mordekaiser main, the man has like, 1million points on the champion or something and iirc he's gotten into high diamond.

Sounds more like you have no proof and you're just fangirling after him.

Wow.

You can ask Malicious himself when you see him or any other "Morde" themed user here. OBVIOUSLY there's threads or I wouldn't be saying this, but digging the right ones up from a damn year and a half ago isn't exactly efficient use of my time.

Regardless, believe what you want. I'm actually done with this.

I've been here for 2 years. I don't know how long MM has, he was here before me because i was on EU Boards prior to that time.

Anyway, there hasn't been proof of him influencing anything regarding Mordekaiser's development post-update or i would know of it. I've read enough of his threads to be more annoyed of it than anything since i wouldn't have a champion tailored after 1 person, regardless how objective they claim to be.

So you better dig up at least one hole or i'll just assume you're fangirling after him which i currently am. (Non-gameplay related changes don't count.)

Or don't care, my opinion will simply remain unchanged then.

The reason he started popular was not only his Mordekaiser threads, but his catchy username and memes.

It's how anybody gets popular.
His gameplay posts were also high quality. That's how I learned about him.
His gameplay posts started after his name gained value and popularity.

False.

I never really bothered with the boards until Riot reworked Mordekaiser and my very first posts were all on the topic of his rework.
I meant the non-Mord ones. I remember you became known as a defender of Mordekaiser, and shortly after your crusade expanded and you started posting memes around that time.
Honestly, I've been having a rough time lately, that's why I haven't been posting much.
Hope things get better for you soon, your memes always cheer me up.

Riot's "admissions" have always been empty admissions. It's like when your kid does something wrong and you tell them to say they're sorry. Sure, they'll say it, but they don't mean it. Especially when they turn around and do it all over again.

Will have to go ahead and vouch for this one. The one team I won't talk any shit on is the art team, but that's a very different world than the balance team--its easier to fix mistakes and input criticism into the art (which we can see through art criticisms and then it's acted upon within a couple of days). The Balance and Friends, on the other hand, tend to make a lot of apologies but it's usually halfhearted at best and not acted upon at all at worst even after months.

The Art team isn't perfect either.
They tend to have this bad habit of just not responding.
They are in no way obligated or required to respond to you or any criticisms you may have for their work.

They also admitted that Vel's rework, although not *bad*, was a mistake due to it not really accomplishing anything. They ALSO admitted that Fiora's VGU was rather hit-n-miss, and that they DEFINITELY screwed up on that initial splash art with that fugly ass chin before they patched it up.

Like, people that hiss at Riot for not admitting their failures just want Riot to stab themselves as a collective per failure.
Saying you are sorry and then doing the same shit again, is insencere. People dont want Riot to stab themselves, they want them to stop lying with their apologies.

So you don't want anything.

League is a game that changes. Unless you literally want for Riot to never update the game again, they're going to have to TRY to update the game. Whether that succeeds or fails depends, but League is a game that's GOING to change. All Riot can do is promise to try it differently the next time if they screw up on the current attempt. That's why they did less reworks *now*...so they could put more effort into making better kits on this attempt. I imagine with numbers tuning and all that jazz we'll get Zac and Mao to a decent spot...at least they're more open to the notion than some of their really bad reworks are...like Yorick.

Wrong.

League is a game that changes, however i want their updates to be good and to be REVERTED if they are bad. Change for the sake of change is BAD.

In my schooll i used to have arts and crafts. When i was making a complex creation from multiple parts, i used only the GOOD parts. When i made a bad part i SCRAPPED IT, instead of forcefully pushing it into my creation for it to be fixed eventually. ANd it does not matter how much effort i put in it, if it was shit i SCRAPPED IT.

If the update is shit, you SCRAP IT, thats it!

> [{quoted}](name=chipndip1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=YGptERpv,comment-id=00030002,timestamp=2017-05-07T05:04:57.347+0000)
>
> and that they DEFINITELY screwed up on that initial splash art with that fugly ass chin before they patched it up.

It's still fugly

http://i.imgur.com/H9Ush0g.jpg

Never forget.

I mean Riot wasn't happy with his state before.  And these revelations that Malzahar support can work won't make him disappear from bot lane either.

Old Malzahar was one of, if not the most uninteractive champion in the game.  The only other champs that came close to his level of "don't play with me" are Soraka and Janna.  AND JANNA WAS MADE TO SPECIFICALLY TO DENY INTERACTIONS!

They were comfortable with reverting Kog'Maw because he was fine before the rework and his existence dictated the balance of on-hit items.

> Old Malzahar was one of, if not the most uninteractive champion in the game. The only other champs that came close to his level of "don't play with me" are Soraka and Janna. AND JANNA WAS MADE TO SPECIFICALLY TO DENY INTERACTIONS!


Well in the case of Malzahar his passive made it even more difficult to interact with him since if you want to go in on him you now also have to deal with his passive shield... which means that it is easier for Malzahar to hang back and stay safe
Unpopular opinion:  We need more champions like {{champion:117}} and {{champion:90}} and less like {{champion:238}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:164}} {{champion:7}}

Yeah having someone who is safe during the laning phase is a niche the game would have to fill.  However someone who forces a bro-lane by pressing W-E for the next 20 god damn minutes is not the way to go.

A lane phase doesn't last 20 minutes, it lasts around 10 to 15 minutes.
All you do is make sure you don't feed for those 10-15 minutes and protect your carries in mid to late game.

While assassins can snowball and kill the enemy carries. A balance of protection and aggression must be present.
However, right now, the aggression is the one that constantly prevails due to rito's gutting defensive or protective playstyles. The only one left supporting that is janna.
Everyone else is just a pale shadow of their former selves.
{{champion:84}} - so many noobs, there's no balance in this game

the quote is 
"So many noobs... will matchmaking ever find true balance?"

Don't feed sounds like it translates to "play as passively as possible and never interact with the enemy laner" which Riot doesn't like. It's not fun or entertaining to just waveclear and have nothing happen because one laner can never successfully be an aggressor, like when Lulu mid was meta you could never even try to solo kill her because of how well she was able to protect herself.

It might not be fun or entertaining, but from a game design prospective it's necessary. 

If your game is full of hard counters and only mindless aggressive gameplay, then you're literally just rolling the dice on which team counters the other team harder. 
I'd even go as far as to argue that while the waveclearing and defensive play styles are boring in lane (the first ~10 minutes of the game), having lanes farm up on equal terms and enter the mid game almost even creates a more exciting team stage of the game, where no one on either team has snowballed enough that the game's already been decided, unless the behind team stalls for another 30+ minutes until everyone has reached full build and gold advantage becomes irrelevant.

There's a difference between defensive play and not being able to aggress on them their defensive tools are so good. Lulu and Malzahar: Can't ever be the aggressor on them. Lulu is too good at defending herself in a solo lane and Malzahar just dicks on you. Defensive play however, is just to minimize the risk of the laner killing you, not almost always being able to stop it.

Except that plenty of champions had no issues playing aggressive against malzahar... 
He wasn't unkillable by any means, he just matched well against the champions who are designed to brainlessly play aggressive and snowball. 

He could force an otherwise aggressive champion to play passively, but allowed normally passive champions (mostly mages) to be played aggressively.

Aggressive play is to maximize the probability of killing the lane opponent, not almost always being able to kill them. Yet you have champions which behave in exactly this manner. The only people who couldn't break malzahar's defense were people who didn't respect his counter engage.

___ 
I'm just gonna rant about this for a minute. 

Riot has been doing this stupid shit, where they're removing tempo breaks from the game and creating a tempo arms race across the champions (it's a miracle irelia hasn't had her stun removed). 
A champion like malzahar was designed to force high tempo aggressive champions into a pace which they don't excel in. However, slower tempo champions (again like most mages) could still be played effectively at the pace, and the tools which forced high tempo champions into a lower pace aren't particularly strong at that lower tempo. 

Riot is basically turning the game into kick boxing without blocking, american football without a defensive line, or baseball without an outfield. 
You've got to have these kind of defensive tempo breaking designs in the game, in order to stop snowballing and keep the game exciting for the length of it. If you don't you're either going to have people stalling out the game and making it even more boring, all because they can't break the tempo of a fed enemy. 

This bothers me even on a personal level, with my experience in competitive fighting, having done  national competitive taekwondo for nearly 6 years. I'm a very long range front leg fighter, and one of my favorite tactics against high tempo opponents (e.x. light, fast, and aggressive) was to spend the first round focused on cut kicking (basically a side kick aimed at the hip or upper thigh to stagger the opponent) this would often force them into a more passive slower fight in the later round(s), which gave me the advantage due to my longer reach, but their early aggression exhausted them far more than I spent cutting them and breaking their tempo. 

These same tactics didn't work against opponents which had more reach, a better slow game than i did, or "spin fighters" (basically people who would had a very good spin heel kick or could time their back kicks well) who could spin as I'd cut them, kind like parrying the kick by redirecting the force. Which is exactly where you see malzahar's weakness coming from. Slow pace champions which have more reach (e.g. lux, xerath, ziggs) a better slow tempo kit (e.g. anivia, brand, syndra) or could break his disruption (e.g. Viktor, Fizz, Zyra, GP #oranges).

Mind you this is speaking in respect to a 1v1 situation. As you add more team mates and opponents into the equation, it becomes more complex and dynamic. Which dynamic tactics, aka strategy, is something that this game has been bleeding as if it had its femoral artery cut. >.>

Which is exactly where you see malzahar's weakness coming from. Slow pace champions which have more reach (e.g. lux, xerath, ziggs) a better slow tempo kit (e.g. anivia, brand, syndra) or could break his disruption (e.g. Viktor, Fizz, Zyra, GP #oranges).

This.


I was shitting on the meta right before they "reworked" him. All that LOLIMADIVEYOU ROFLCOPTER IMASSAINSATING SOGUD fast paced shit stopped fast. If I positioned incorrectly, or an opponent was smart enough to *BAIT THE FUCKING SPELLS SO ULT ALONE WOULDNT KILL THEM* then I got wrecked. But for the most part, it felt beyond satisfying to play mid as mage when adc assassins were shitting all over the place there. Zed ult dive? Yeah, fuck you. Enjoy your "LOL IMAULT YOU ON TOWER BECUZ IM PRO" death. 


And this guy already understands who countered old Malz. 

"Omg Im asrrassin n i cnt just roflstompds him aftr gting 2 kilz wtf nerf pls so unfun"

it happens.
this game has 3 stages

early (lane phase)
mid (small fights)
late (team fights or split push)

characters that "don't feed" for 10-15 minutes are simply avoiding trading and losing the game in the first 10 minutes, focusing on the other 2 stages of the game

and when Lulu mid was meta, you could................. roam to other lanes and kill those????
if someone is safe, the counter to that is to attack another part of the enemy team. Its simple, obvious, doesn't require lcs communication to formulate that strategy

the thing is, rito does whatever the fuck rito wants. And often, that is a faliure. As an exemplified by how many of the reworks are considered a failure by the community

Thats exactly what I did, swapped to Vi and Elise until the WW rework but before that I was a one trick {{champion:72}} 

Ruined the champ forever. 
RiP: Skarner
2015
Wait. They admitted they were wrong with the Kog'Maw rework and reverted that.
imo, they're arnt wrong to rework the champion, but the outcome isn't the best.
where did all of you people praising riot repertoir go? You know the ones that were flooding the boards a while back ?

hiding in the same hole repetoir is in after he failed rework after rework after rework and decided to just stop posting on the boards, out of sight out of mind right

he'll occasionally post on reddit because they've turned dick sucking into an art form there
Probably got tired of how you essentially never win on the boards. Negativity is the spice of the day, all day, every day.
